RECORD.TEXT: 173906547 943713 DIS Report Status : Unsigned NAME : GURNEPASCCAUGH , NIA L UNIT NUMBER : 990-30-76 05/14/1999 ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSIS : 2. Congestive heart failure . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : 5/18/99 Coronary artery bypass graft using the left internal mammary artery to the left anterior descending , saphenous vein graft to the posterior descending artery and posterior left ventricular artery and the saphenous vein graft to the diagonal artery . The patient is a 64-year-old woman with accelerating angina pectoris , who had a cardiac catheterization at Chimass Community Hospital revealing three-vessel disease . The patient was transferred to Ph University Of Medical Center for a cardiac surgical evaluation . Her CKs were found to be elevated with a peak of 1237 with only one increase in MB fractionation . She had a repeat cardiac catheterization at Chimass Community Hospital on 5/13/99 , which showed three-vessel disease , including right coronary artery 70% ostial , left anterior descending 70% , circumflex 100% . Her ejection fraction was estimated at 60% . There was 1 mitral regurgitation . The patient was transferred to the Ph University Of Medical Center . HOSPITAL COURSE : The bypasses are listed above . The bypass time was 2 hours , 19 minutes , cross-clamp time was 1 hour , 36 minutes . The patient received 3 units of packed red blood cells . Postoperatively , the patient was taken to the Surgical Intensive Care Unit . 1. Cardiovascular : The patient 's postoperative course was routine . Prior to her transfer to the Goman 12 Unit , her last cardiac index in the Surgical Intensive Care Unit had been between 2.0 and 2.2 . 2. Renal : Her potassium was 4.3 . Her creatinine was 4.2. 3 . Her regular insulin consisted of insulin sliding scale . It should be pointed out , however , that a urinalysis from 5/14/99 showed positive white blood cells . However , this was in the setting of the patient , who more than likely has colonization of her bladder secondary to decreased to no urine output . At the time of discharge , the patient was in satisfactory condition , tolerating good PO intake on her renal diet . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : NPH insulin 8 units subq q PM before dinner . Aspirin 81 mg. PO QD . Phoslo 6 mg. PO TID . Epogen 4000 units IV on Tuesdays and Wednesdays . Tylenol 650 mg. PO q 6 h PRN pain . At the time of discharge , the patient was planned to go to rehabilitation . The patient should also follow up with Dr. Lishdail , her Renal Specialist . OTESA KOTEVI , M.D. TR : DD : TD : 05/22/1999 10:06 A cc :
